text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The candidate answer explicitly notes that the Belgian officers were acting in accordance with Article 9(5)-(6) in section 2 (Relevant provisions) and section 3 (Interpretation of the provisions), stating: \"Art. 9(5)-(6) expressly authorises an officer to \u2018identify the vessel, seek to obtain the necessary information \u2026 and, if the matter is sufficiently serious, order the vessel to stop and, if necessary, board the vessel for enquiry.\u2019 The Belgian officers merely requested information; they did not order the vessel to stop or board it. Their conduct is therefore fully within the limits set by the Convention.\" This directly addresses the criterion.", "criterion_id": "criterion 5"}
